comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Possibly related to this article:

POLICEWOMEN AT BEACH:
These Newport Officers Wear Brass Buttons and Carry No Clubs
New York Times, 16 June 1913

Seems two women were appointed to serve as policewomen at Newport Beach that summer:  Jeannette Buchanan (a schoolteacher) and Minnie Smith (a settlement house worker).  The article describes their uniform:  "military blouses of blue, but brass buttons, blue skirts to match, and straw hats."  "One promenaded the beach with a parasol," the article continues, which might well be this one (note parasol folded at her side).

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  Thank you for the article on the policewomen at Newport Beach.  It seems possible that the woman in the image is one of  the two mentioned in the article.  We will add some of the information to the description when we upload the database.
